instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.LP8550: What is LP8550? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks from 2011 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, backlight no display. Apple refurbished board
threads.message:
I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> doing some bizarre things.

Backlight no display, pulled all peripherals without change, Tested with a known good display.

It sometimes shows backlight no display, and other times, it Chimes over and over again, Each time it chimes, the chime becomes more and more distorted.

The board has the dreaded white apple sticker on it suggesting its a refurbished board, It looks like it had liquid damage at some point, but the board has definitely been cleaned. 

Tried reprogrammed <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, reflown SMC, replaced <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP>, but its made no odds, im thinking the PCH or CPU is dead? anyone seen this fault before?
Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, backlight no display. Apple refurbished board
threads.message:
"It sometimes shows backlight no display"
I don't exactly understand that.
Do you get sometime image without backlight?
The rest of time nothing?

Repeated chimes shouldn't be related with display issues.
There should be something affecting PCH/CPU.
Remove J6100 and inspect all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors.
Put quality flux and heat CPU untill 180-200 degrees...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, backlight no display. Apple refurbished board
threads.message:
Backlight with no image.
J6100 is okay, so are the termination resistors.

The rest of the time, it Posts with the apple chime noise, And then chimes again but slightly more distorted, and then again, and again. 

Repeated chimes can be due to Display or GPU initialisation in my experience.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, backlight no display. Apple refurbished board
threads.message:
There is no dedicated GPU and it should start normal without LCD connected.
As the board has only iGPU, CPU is first suspect anyway...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, backlight no display. Apple refurbished board
threads.message:
I know that, I was just stating that it can cause similar issues. 

Anyway, I was using the wifi card to test wifi on another unit and it started doing the same thing. Its the wifi card surprisingly. Close thread.
